synthesis_conditions.equipment: 23 mL Teflon liner stainless steel reactor

synthesis_conditions.description: Hydrated phase obtained by exposing 1·H2O·C2H5OH to air humidity for a period of time until saturation adsorption within 10 min.
Intermediate phase obtained during the hydration of 1 in the first ~1min, giving a partly hydrated phase with one H2O molecule accommodated in cage A leaving cage B still empty.

Iodine-loaded phase obtained by soaking 1·H2O·C2H5OH crystals in a 5 ml of iodine cyclohexane solution (0.1 M/L). After uptake of iodine, the resulting violet crystals were separated, thoroughly washed with cyclohexane, and dried in air.
50% photoreactive intermediate captured by irradiating crystals of 1·H2O·C2H5OH for 13 h.
